* * *

* Week 1 (Jan 14, 16): Review concepts and ideas from `rmarkdown`, `knitr`, `bookdown`, Git, and GitHub
    
    + [R Markdown](http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com/)
    
    + [knitr](https://yihui.name/knitr/)
    
    + [bookdown: Authoring Books and Technical Documents with R Markdown](https://bookdown.org/yihui/bookdown/)
    
    + [Happy Git and GitHub for the useR](http://happygitwithr.com/)

    + Send an email to arnholtat@appstate.edu with a Subject line of **STT3860 - GitHub Username**, and tell me in the body of your email your first name, last name, and your GitHub username.  
    
    + Follow the directions from [Happy Git and GitHub for the useR](http://happygitwithr.com/) to [Introduce yourself to Git](http://happygitwithr.com/hello-git.html), [Connect to GitHub](http://happygitwithr.com/push-pull-github.html), and [Cache credentials for HTTPS](http://happygitwithr.com/credential-caching.html).
    
    + [Set Global Options](https://stat-ata-asu.github.io/STT5812CourseRepo/Rmarkdown/GlobalOptions.html)
    
    + [GitHub Classroom Information/Practice Assignment --- Click link and accept assignment --- must be enrolled in the class](https://classroom.github.com/a/jfwFmKWD)
